gloss: Existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical or concrete existence.
To gather together or acquire an increasing number or quantity of.
Correct in all details; exact.
To buy or obtain an asset or object; to learn or develop a skill.
Satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity.
Next to or adjoining something else.
To publicly recommend or support.
Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
To distribute resources or duties for a particular purpose.
The quality of being open to more than one interpretation; inexactness.
Open to more than one interpretation; not having one obvious meaning.
A strong desire to do or achieve something.
A comparison between two things, typically for the purpose of explanation or clarification.
Relating to or using analysis or logical reasoning.
To add something to the end of a written document.
To recognize the full worth of; to be grateful for.
Close to the actual, but not completely accurate or exact.
Based on random choice or personal whim, rather than any reason or system.
Having or showing the ability to speak fluently and coherently.
To fit together the separate component parts of; to gather together in one place.
To evaluate or estimate the nature, ability, or quality of.
To allocate a job or duty to someone; to designate or set aside for a purpose.
To help someone, typically by doing a share of the work.
To suppose to be the case, without proof; to take or begin to have.
To tell someone something positively to dispel any doubts.
To fasten; join; to be connected with.
To succeed in achieving something, typically after much effort.
To regard something as being caused by.
A writer of a book, article, or report.
The power or right to give orders, make decisions, and enforce obedience.
Working by itself with little or no direct human control.
Able to be used or obtained; at someone's disposal.
Having knowledge or perception of a situation or fact.
In the interests of; as a representative of.
Favorable or advantageous; resulting in good.
Well meaning and kindly.
Prejudice in favor of or against one thing, person, or group compared with another.
A connection or relationship between people or groups based on shared feelings, interests, or experiences.
Concise and exact use of words in writing or speech.
Of short duration; using few words.
The mass or magnitude of something large; the majority or greater part.
Having the ability, fitness, or quality necessary to do or achieve something.
The maximum amount that something can contain or produce; the ability or power to do something.
A person or thing that precipitates an event or change.
A class or division of people or things regarded as having particular shared characteristics.
To come or bring to an end.
A call to take part in a contest or competition; a task or situation that tests someone's abilities.
A method or system for communication or distribution.
A main division of a book; a period of time or an episode in a person's life.
A fact or condition connected with or relevant to an event or action.
Relating to ordinary citizens and their concerns; courteous and polite.
To make a statement or situation less confused and more clearly comprehensible.
Judged over a period of time to be of the highest quality and outstanding of its kind.
A particular and separate article, stipulation, or proviso in a treaty, bill, or contract.
A system of words, letters, figures, or symbols used to represent others; program instructions.
Related to the mental action or process of acquiring knowledge and understanding through thought, experience, and the senses.
Logical and consistent; forming a unified whole.
To occur at the same time; to be in agreement.
To work jointly on an activity or project.
To begin; to start.
A verbal or written remark expressing an opinion or reaction.
To carry out or perpetrate; to pledge or bind to a certain course or policy.
A raw material or primary agricultural product that can be bought and sold.
To share or exchange information, news, or ideas.
A group of people living in the same place or having a particular characteristic in common.
Able to exist or occur together without conflict; able to be used together.
To give someone something, typically money, in recognition of loss, suffering, or injury.
To produce something by assembling information collected from other sources.
Showing smug or uncritical satisfaction with oneself or one's achievements.
A thing that completes or brings to perfection.
Consisting of many different and connected parts; not easy to analyze or understand.
A part or element of a larger whole.
A thing that is composed of two or more separate elements.
Complete; including all or nearly all elements or aspects of something.
To form or devise a plan or idea in the mind.
To focus one's attention or mental effort on a particular object or activity.
An abstract idea or general notion.
To bring something to an end; to arrive at a judgment or opinion by reasoning.
Existing, happening, or done at the same time.
To organize and carry out; to lead or guide.
To have discussions; to grant or bestow a title, degree, benefit, or right.
To keep or restrict someone or something within certain limits.
To establish the truth or correctness of something previously believed or suspected.
A serious disagreement or argument; a prolonged armed struggle.
To comply with rules, standards, or laws; to be similar in form or type.
Permission for something to happen or agreement to do something.
Following as a result or effect.
Notably large in size, amount, or extent.
To be composed or made up of.
Occurring continuously over a period of time; remaining unchanged.
To be a part of a whole; to be equivalent to.
To severely restrict the scope, extent, or activity of.
To build or erect something; to form an idea or theory by bringing together various elements.
To seek information or advice from someone; to have discussions or confer with someone.
To eat, drink, or ingest; to use up a resource.
The state of physical touching; communication with someone.
Living or occurring at the same time; belonging to or occurring in the present.
A principle or standard by which something may be judged or decided.
Humble submission and respect.
Relating to the structure of populations.
Having or showing care and conscientiousness in one's work or duties.
Showing a great deal of variety; very different.
Unconventional and slightly strange.
Involving many carefully arranged parts or details; detailed and complicated.
Fluent or persuasive in speaking or writing.
The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
Based on observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
A person or thing that is mysterious, puzzling, or difficult to understand.
Lasting for a very short time; transitory.
Lasting for a very short time.
A feeling or state of intense excitement and happiness.
Treating serious issues with deliberately inappropriate humor.
To make an action or process easy or easier.
An essential supporting structure; a basic structure underlying a system, concept, or text.
Not having any serious purpose or value.
Truly what something is said to be; authentic.
The quality of being thankful; readiness to show appreciation.
Fond of company; sociable.
The quality of forming a pleasing and consistent whole.
Extremely distressing or disturbing; acutely painful or traumatic.
A system in which members of an organization are ranked according to relative status or authority.
A supposition or proposed explanation made on the basis of limited evidence as a starting point for further investigation.
A system of ideas and ideals, especially one which forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.
To explain or make something clear by using examples, charts, pictures, etc.
Suggested though not directly expressed; implied.
To take in or contain as part of a whole; to include.
Certain to happen; unavoidable.
The basic physical and organizational structures and facilities needed for the operation of a society or enterprise.
Existing in something as a permanent, essential, or characteristic attribute.
Featuring new methods; advanced and original.
The quality of being honest and having strong moral principles.
Coming between two things in time, place, order, character, etc.
Belonging naturally; essential.
To cite or appeal to someone or something as an authority for an action or in support of an argument.
Special words or expressions used by a profession or group that are difficult for others to understand.
The action of showing something to be right or reasonable.
To place or deal with close together for contrasting effect.
The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
Relating to or resulting from motion.
Facts, information, and skills acquired through experience or education.
Something handed down from an ancestor or predecessor.
Conforming to the law or to rules; able to be defended with logic or justification.
Full of or shedding light; bright or shining.
Generous or forgiving, especially toward a rival or less powerful person.
Relating to or situated at the edge or margin; of secondary importance.
A system of parts working together in a machine; a piece of machinery.
A system of methods used in a particular area of study or activity.
Showing great attention to detail; very careful and precise.
The impetus and driving force gained by the development of a process or course of events.
A spoken or written account of connected events; a story.
A sentimental longing or wistful affection for the past.
Famous or well known, typically for some bad quality or deed.
A subtle difference in or shade of meaning, expression, or sound.
Not influenced by personal feelings or opinions in considering and representing facts.
No longer produced or used; out of date.
Best or most favorable; optimum.
A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
Never ending or changing; occurring repeatedly.
A particular attitude toward or way of regarding something; a point of view.
A fact or situation that is observed to exist or happen, especially one whose cause is in question.
Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
Denoting an action or event preceding or done in preparation for something fuller or more important.
Widespread in a particular area at a particular time.
A fundamental truth or proposition that serves as the foundation for a system of belief or behavior.
The official procedure or system of rules governing affairs of state or diplomatic occasions.
Relating to or measured by the quality of something rather than its quantity.
The standard of something as measured against other things of a similar kind.
Representing the most perfect or typical example of a quality or class.
Based on or in accordance with reason or logic.
To respond to a gesture or action by making a corresponding one.
Closely connected or appropriate to what is being done or considered.
Able to withstand or recover quickly from difficult conditions.
To bring back to a former condition, place, or position.
The occurrence of events by chance in a happy or beneficial way.
Sufficiently great or important to be worthy of attention; noteworthy.
To imitate the appearance or character of; to produce a computer model of.
Uncomplicated and easy to do or understand.
Coming after something in time; following.
Of considerable importance, size, or worth.
To strengthen or support physically or mentally; to cause to continue.
To cause to occur or operate at the same time or rate.
Perceptible by touch; clear and definite; real.
Not certain or fixed; provisional.
Concerned with or involving the theory of a subject rather than its practical application.
By that means; as a result of that.
The transmission of customs or beliefs from generation to generation.
To make a thorough or dramatic change in the form, appearance, or character of.
Present, appearing, or found everywhere.
The fact of appearing everywhere or of being very common.
To experience or be subjected to something, typically something unpleasant.
Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
Relating to or done by all people or things in the world or in a particular group; applicable to all cases.
To check or prove the validity or accuracy of something.
Using or expressed in more words than are needed.
Able to adapt or be adapted to many different functions or activities.
Playfully quaint or fanciful, especially in an appealing and amusing way.
The quality of having experience, knowledge, and good judgment.
Dislike of or prejudice against people from other countries.
A feeling of intense longing for something.
Having or showing zeal; fervent or enthusiastic.
